**Please describe your request**

Incorrect syntax for **npm install -g botdispatch @microsoft/botframework-cli**

If you follow this syntax, the "bf" modules of the CLI are NOT installed. This will produce multiple errors when trying to run the deploy.ps1 script. Instead, I think you need to run the following command:

**npm install -g @microsoft/botframework-cli**

This will also install the "bf" modules of the CLI, which is needed in order to run various bf commands during the initial virtual assistant deployment. 

**Is this an issue with current documentation? If yes, please provide the link.**

https://microsoft.github.io/botframework-solutions/virtual-assistant/tutorials/create-assistant/csharp/2-download-and-install/

/virtual-assistant/tutorials/customize-assistant/csharp/4-edit-your-cognitive-models/.

When I do all the steps provided in this webpage there is no change to the VirtualAssistant. Due to which I couldn't submit to the AzureHeros challenge. I looked at these steps multiple times and reverified but the changes done by me to the existing knowledgebase are not picked by the BOT. the Intents/questions are unrecognized by the BOT. so fix this page to reflect the right steps.

/virtual-assistant/tutorials/customize-assistant/csharp/3-edit-responses/

the first parameter of LocaleTemplateManager is Dictionary<string, string> so if you define localizedTemplates as DIctionary<string, List<string>> then this piece of code doesn't compile.
![error_add_addtional_responses](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51310192/85694637-ee080580-b6f4-11ea-9926-8944087faaac.PNG)

/overview/virtual-assistant-solution/ says:

> At it’s core the Virtual Assistant (available in C# and TypeScript) is a project template with the best practices for developing a bot on the Microsoft Azure platform.

"it's" should be "its", as it is possessive.

( a comma after "At its core" might help readability, too )

/virtual-assistant/tutorials/customize-assistant/csharp/2-edit-your-greeting/

This link in the JSON results in a 404 page in GitHub: https://aka.ms/botframeworkskills

Hello, I am following the create skill tutorial on the Bot Framework solution website. 
[Link to the tutoral](https://microsoft.github.io/botframework-solutions/skills/tutorials/create-skill/csharp/2-download-and-install/)

I am having a hard time to connect a new skill to my bot. 
I ran the given command, 
`botskills connect --remoteManifest "https://<YOUR_SKILL_NAME>.azurewebsites.net/manifest/manifest-1.1.json" --cs --luisFolder "path-to-lu-folder".`

But I hit the two errors. 
1. 

> The 'endpointUrl' property of the selected endpoint contains invalid characters or does not comply with the URL format. If you didn't select any endpoint, the first one is taken by default.
> There was an error while connecting the Skill to the Assistant:
> Error: One or more properties are missing from your Skill Manifest

2. 

> Error: Some of the cultures provided to connect from the Skill are not available or aren't supported by your VA.
> Make sure you have a Dispatch for the cultures you are trying to connect, and that your Skill has a LUIS model for that culture

I found out the first error happened because the manifest endURL should be all lowercase. 
It seemed the issue was fixed for ts, not for cs. ([related old ticket: ](https://github.com/microsoft/botframework-solutions/issues/3223). After I changed my endUrl to be all lowercase, I could move on. (SideNote: could you fix the issue in cs as well?)

But I hit the second error that I cannot figure out the root cause. 
I have the latest botskills CLI tool, and I provided the correct path to the LU folder. Do I need to run other scripts related to cognitive models (ex: deploy_cognitive_models.ps1 or update_cognitive_models.ps1) before I run `botskills connect`? Or are there any other missing steps that I need to do before I run `botskills connect`?

Let me know what information I can provide from my end to debug this issue further.
Thanks!

/virtual-assistant/tutorials/customize-assistant/typescript/2-edit-your-greeting/

I installed the bot virtual assistant template using the yo bot-virtualassistant command but could not find either src/content or src/locales directories. Am I doing something wrong?

In Manifest (/skills/handbook/manifest/) the manifest points to 
> https://schemas.botframework.com/schemas/skills/skill-manifest-2.0.0.json
but should point to
> https://schemas.botframework.com/schemas/skills/v2.0/skill-manifest.json
isn't it?
Even there's some reference to `dispatchModels` that only exists on
> https://schemas.botframework.com/schemas/skills/v2.1/skill-manifest.json

Which one is the proper one?

Thanks

/solution-accelerators/assistants/hospitality-assistant/

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66396148/83787071-1053b980-a648-11ea-88da-5f57e3c51890.png)

This url [feedback documentation](https://microsoft.github.io/botframework-solutions/virtual-assistant/handbook/feedback/) is extremely useful except at the part where it says:

FeedbackOptions consists of the following. You can alter any of the properties when you declare your options in startup.cs

Then it doesn't proceed to show an example of how to enable or disable any of the table of features below that line of text.  

I posted this to StackOverFlow two days ago and I received not a single response. The botframework documentation seems to do this a bunch.  Talk about how to do something like a new feature and documentation describe it, show parts of how it works, then leave out the most critical part of seeing the new functionality in C# code.

/virtual-assistant/tutorials/customize-assistant/csharp/4-edit-your-cognitive-models/

but it is not.

Deployment\Resources\Dispatch\en-us\XXXen-us_Dispatch.json

Is this expected? My assumption is that it should update the dispatch module with all the associated  Skill LUIS models' utterances

When I deploy my custom skill, using the deployment script, all resources get a postfix "bot-skill-luisauthoring-ulpptwf" f.ex. What does that postfix mean and how can I deploy my custom skill without a postfix?

Andreas

/skills/tutorials/create-skill/csharp/4-provision-your-azure-resources/

The tutorial seems to mention about password being for AD as
_"password for the Azure Active Directory App "_

When I checked the logs and build script it is not clear how it interacts with Azure Active Directory App. Instead, this gets treated as the appPassword of the webapp-bot.

Please can you add a bit more clarity to this portion of the document.
We added the concept of a skill or skill bot to the SDK back in R7 or so. We should be explicit here whether VA skills are skill bots or something different.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

As part of the Virtual Assistant [deployment documentation](https://github.com/microsoft/AI/blob/master/docs/tutorials/assistantandskilldeploymentsteps.md), it asks to set the application registration to allow `Accounts in any organizational directory`.

However, it doesn't describe the implications are of this overlooked setting.

- For example, say we want this application to only be available to employees of a particular organization. Should we still set the app registration to `Accounts in any organizational directory` and then build authentication into the bot elsewhere?
- What if we are required to set it to `Accounts in this organizational directory only`. For example, say you're deploying this for a client and their security practices don't allow us to make this change. How can we work around this?
- How does this impact testing with the bot emulator? How about through the Azure Portal interface?

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I'd like the documentation to describe a work around for having the application registration set to `Accounts in this organizational directory only`.

Alternatively, I'd like the documentation to explain how to ensure that the bot can only be accessed by users who have signed in (employees of a certain organization) while still having the application registration set to `Accounts in any organizational directory`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Maybe it's simply not possible to run the Virtual Assistant without having it set to `Accounts in any organizational directory`. That would be good to know.

**Additional context**

I also created a [Stack Overflow post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56061467/what-are-the-implications-of-setting-application-registration-to-accounts-in-an) on this topic. I see this as both a question and a feature request for expanded documentation.

# Documentation for Build

Our Build release will bring sizeable changes to the Virtual Assistant solution accelerator (moving to a template) and the addition of Skills to Bot Framework all-up. 

Therefore a new set of documentation is required. This is a *living* issue to track the outstanding documentation required and progress, feel free to add.

## Virtual Assistant Template

| Documentation       | Description                              | common                                | csharp                                 | typescript                            |

- [x] Calendar
- [x] Email
- [x] To Do
- [x] Point of Interest

**Project**
Virtual Assistant

**Description**
Using the az bot command to create authsettings, I have a related issue when I try to create the AADv2 connection. It doesn't run for me. I get the error below

**To Reproduce**

1. Key in this command:- `az bot authsetting create --resource-group YOUR_BOT_NAME --name YOUR_BOT_NAME --setting-name "YOUR_AUTH_CONNECTION_NAME" --client-id "YOUR_APPLICATION_ID" --client-secret "YOUR_APPLICATION_PASSWORD" --provider-scope-string "Calendars.ReadWrite Mail.Read Mail.Send Notes.ReadWrite People.Read User.Read" --service Aadv2`
2. Command doesn't work. I end up with error below. 

```
az bot authsetting create: error: the following arguments are required: --provider-scope-string, --service
usage: az bot authsetting create [-h] [--verbose] [--debug]
                                 [--output {json,jsonc,table,tsv,yaml,none}]
                                 [--query JMESPATH] --resource-group
                                 RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME --name NAME
                                 --setting-name CONNECTION_NAME --client-id
                                 CLIENT_ID --client-secret CLIENT_SECRET
                                 --provider-scope-string SCOPES --service
                                 SERVICE_PROVIDER_NAME
                                 [--parameters PARAMETERS [PARAMETERS ...]]
                                 [--subscription _SUBSCRIPTION]
```
**Expected behavior**
The aadv2 connection should be created and oauth settings fields populated.

Feedback:

- [ ] `az botservice` is not needed anymore, it is already removed from the docs (https://github.com/Microsoft/AI/pull/542) but not from the readme in https://github.com/Microsoft/AI/blob/master/templates/Enterprise-Template/src/csharp/EnterpriseBotTemplate/Bot%20Framework/readme.md and in https://github.com/Microsoft/AI/blob/master/templates/Enterprise-Template/src/csharp/EnterpriseBotSample/readme.md
- [ ] The reference to the LUIS portal does not mention that there are multiple portals and that you should use the portal that belongs to your region. Otherwise you get issues with your authoring keys (see https://github.com/Microsoft/AI/blob/87c033bde9dd1e7b55cc03fa7ec7474acd36ed29/solutions/Virtual-Assistant/docs/virtualassistant-createvirtualassistant.md#L76)
- [ ] The readme seems to assumes that people use `cmd.exe`. When using e.g. PowerShell, passing the `appSecret` in `msbot clone services` results in an error.

**Description**
Standardize `AzureMapsKey` usage in the POI skill. Documentation refers to it as `AzureMaps-Key` but code uses `AzureMapsKey`. We will stick to `AzureMapsKey` everywhere.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

The Subscription Key for the LUIS models in the .bot file generated by msbot is set to the authoring key.

msbot generates a LUIS service in azure and it should use this key instead of the authoring key in the bot file.

Also, the msbot tool generates the LUIS apps for the solution but doesn't assign the LUIS subscription key to it (it should for the above to work).

I'm not sure if the existing APIs allow to do any of this but if it doesn't it should be noted in the documentation so people don't use authoring keys for deployed bots.
